parts.text: {"word":"benefiting","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vi","definition":"利益を得る、恩恵を受ける","english_definition":"receiving an advantage; profiting","examples":[{"sentence":"The town is benefiting from the new factory.","translation":"その町は新しい工場から利益を得ている。"},{"sentence":"Who will be benefiting from these tax cuts?","translation":"誰がこれらの減税から恩恵を受けるのだろうか？"}],"collocations":["benefiting from","benefiting greatly","benefiting directly"],"synonyms":["profiting","gaining","advantaging","thriving"],"antonyms":["losing","suffering","worsening"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"利益を与える、恩恵を与える","english_definition":"":"conferring an advantage; helping","examples":[{"sentence":"The new law is benefiting many small businesses.","translation":"新しい法律は多くの小規模企業に利益を与えている。"},{"sentence":"Exercise is benefiting your health.","translation":"運動はあなたの健康に恩恵を与えている。"}],"collocations":["benefiting someone","benefiting society","benefiting the environment"],"synonyms":["aiding","assisting","helping","improving","enhancing"],"antonyms":["harming","hurting","damaging","hindering"]}],"etymology":{"value":"From the verb 'benefit', which comes from Old French 'bienfait' (good deed) and Latin 'benefactum' (a good deed, service), from 'bene facere' (to do well).","priority":"★★★"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˈbɛnɪfɪtɪŋ/","syllables":"be-ne-fit-ing"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["benefit","benefits"],"past_simple":"benefited","past_participle":"benefited","present_participle":"benefiting"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Benefiting' is the present participle and gerund form of the verb 'benefit'. It can be used in continuous tenses (e.g., 'is benefiting') or as a gerund (e.g., 'Benefiting from exercise is good for you'). It implies an ongoing action of receiving or giving benefits.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"The company is benefiting to the new policies.","correct":"The company is benefiting from the new policies.","note":"The correct preposition to use with 'benefiting' is 'from'."},{"incorrect":"Benefiting the poor is a good thing to do.","correct":"Benefiting the poor is a good thing to do. / Helping the poor is a good thing to do.","note":"While grammatically correct, it's more common to use 'helping' in this context, as 'benefiting' can sound slightly formal or indirect."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["benefit (noun, verb)","beneficial (adjective)","beneficiary (noun)"],"phrases":["benefiting society","benefiting the environment","benefiting economically"],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"Relatively common, but less frequent than 'benefit' or 'beneficial'.","priority":"★★☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"'Benefiting' is the present participle of 'benefit', meaning to receive an advantage or to give an advantage. It's used in continuous verb tenses to describe an action that is currently happening or ongoing. It's also used as a gerund (a verb acting as a noun). The word is commonly used in contexts related to economics, health, and social welfare.","priority":"★★☆"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The students are benefiting from the new tutoring program.","translation":"生徒たちは新しい個別指導プログラムから恩恵を受けている。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"receiving benefit"},{"sentence":"The project is benefiting the local community.","translation":"そのプロジェクトは地域社会に利益をもたらしている。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"giving benefit"},{"sentence":"Benefiting from the experience, she made better decisions in the future.","translation":"その経験から利益を得て、彼女は将来より良い決断を下した。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"receiving benefit"},{"sentence":"The company is benefiting financially from its new product line.","translation":"その会社は新製品ラインから経済的に利益を得ている。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"receiving benefit"},{"sentence":"By reducing pollution, we are benefiting the environment.","translation":"汚染を減らすことで、私たちは環境に恩恵を与えている。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"giving benefit"}]}
